NAEB OPENS WASHINGTON OFFICE
August 22, I960, Urhana, Illinois—Dr. Harry J. Skomia,
president of the National Association of Educational Broadcasters
announced today that the NAEB will open an office in Washington, D. C.,
on September 1. William G. Harley, chairman of the hoard of NAEB,
will head the staff at the DuPont Circle Building, 13**6 Connecticut
Avenue, N.W.
Harley, who is on leave of absence from his duties as program
director of Station WHA-TV at the University of Wisconsin, will succeed
Skornia as president of the NAEB effective November 1. Skomia has
resigned as of that date to devote full time to teaching television
and radio in the college of journalism and communications at the
University of Illinois.

August 22, i960
